heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 28 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.4°C), outside temperature (down 5.6°C), and inside temperature (down 1.9°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 46.9°C), feels like temperature (up 49.4°C), and outside temperature (up 49.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 179.8m higher than yesterday, 91.1m higher than the past week, 242.6m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 821m to a maximum of 3400m, averaging 1974.7m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1883.6m and 1732.1m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, pleasant humidity levels and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and periods of sunshine are expected. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
